Even if you’re not fighting for wardrobe space, streamlining your shoe collection is transformative. Not only will you be better off financially, but you’re left with a selection of styles that you’re actually going to wear.

Keep reading as I round up the men’s shoes that go with everything. From sneakers and loafers to boots and Derbies, these are the essential options that every guy should invest in.

Key Takeaways

To help you face the music, too, I’ve been on a one-man mission to create a definitive list of the styles that no collection should be without. After mourning my Mihara Yasuhiros and grieving for Guccis, I’ve pored over hundreds of ratings, reviews, and Reddit forums to bring together every shoe, sneaker, and boot worthy of your consideration.

Buying Considerations for Men’s Shoes That Go With Everything

Color

Avoid bold patterns or fancy colors, and opt for versatile shoes in black, brown, or navy. These will forever be in favor and can be easily paired with a wide range of outfits for numerous occasions. For sneakers, white is undefeated.

Style

When looking for men’s shoes that go with everything, it’s important to stick to classic designs such as loafers, oxfords, or minimalist sneakers. Although statement styles can quickly become yesterday’s news, these types of shoes will remain stylish and adaptable for years to come.

Material

If you’re buying fewer shoes, then material quality is more important than ever. Make sure to invest in high-quality fabrics such as leather or suede, as they offer the utmost durability and comfort, as well as a timeless appearance that complements various clothing styles.
